reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Ammattivalmennus ja tyopaikkojen luominen Nairobin slummivaestolle oppisopimuksen kautta
Youth Employment Creation and Technical Training in the Greater Nairobi

description.narrative: This is a three-year-project that covers most of the slums of the Greater Nairobi. It aims at creating employment for underprivileged youth by providing technical and entrepreneurial training. The Dual Training System will be used in the training. The trai nees (900 youths pa) will have hands-on experience while training. It will foster gender equality by giving women priority in the training.Three Vocational Training Institutions (VTIs) involved: St Kizito VTI Imani Marianist Strathmore Educational Trust th at promotes Eastlands College of Technology is the leading VTI. Three VTIs use the Dual Training System of training. All the trainees received training in soft and entrepreneurial skills. The 3 VTIs have worked with the Agency for Disability and Developmen t in Africa (ADDA) and will continue the partnership to cater for people with disabilities This have resulted that an average of 70% of the graduates find employment or create their own enterprises within six months of leaving the VTIs. At the end of the p roject the VTIs will be better equipped and the trainers will have increased their capacities.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

tag.narrative: Generating jobs, livelihood opportunities and well-being in a developing country is the main prio rity area in this activity
Strengthening of the rights and status of women and girls is a secondary priority area in this activity
